p: 4. Relations ➜ referrals ➜ indications. As indications, signs are a subset of referrals, and referrals in turn are a subset of relations—but all of this only in the most universal-formal sense. Therefore, saying that a sign “is a relation” is of no help here. In fact, we will eventually have to show that “relations,” precisely because of their universal-formal character, have the source of their being in referrals. ☞
